# Pull Request

## Title

- Concise and descriptive title (use imperative mood): "Add X", "Fix Y", "Refactor Z"

## Description

- What does this PR change and why?
- Context and motivation
- Screenshots or logs (if UI/behavioral)

## Linked issues

- Closes #<issue-number>
- Relates to #<issue-number>

## Type of change

- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Bug fix
- [ ] Refactor / Cleanup
- [ ] Docs / Chore
- [ ] CI/CD / Build
- [ ] Performance
- [ ] Other

## How has this been tested?

- [ ] Unit tests
- [ ] Integration tests
- [ ] Manual validation (describe steps)
- [ ] Not applicable

Test notes:

- Steps taken, environments used, data/state assumptions

## Breaking changes

- [ ] Yes (describe migration plan)
- [ ] No

If breaking:

- Migration steps and fallbacks

## Documentation updates

- [ ] README / docs updated
- [ ] API docs updated
- [ ] Not applicable

## Checklist

- [ ] Code builds locally without errors
- [ ] Linting passes (ruff/flake8/mypy as applicable)
- [ ] Tests added/updated and passing
- [ ] Backwards compatibility considered
- [ ] Security and secrets handled appropriately

## Reviewers

- Request reviews from relevant owners/experts

## CI expectations

- All required checks should pass (build, lint, tests)
- Optional checks can be tracked and addressed separately
